consoles.name: Nintendo Entertainment System
consoles.fact: 36 years ago today, the **Nintendo Entertainment System** (NES) released in North America! Released on October 18, 1985, the NES revitalized the video game industry and introduced iconic franchises like Super Mario Bros.

consoles.name: Sega Master System
consoles.fact: 35 years ago today, the **Sega Master System** made its debut in North America! Released in September 1986, the Master System was Sega's first entry into the console market and competed with the NES.

consoles.name: Atari 7800
consoles.fact: 35 years ago today, the **Atari 7800** was released in North America! Released in June 1986, the 7800 aimed to revive Atari's gaming fortunes with backward compatibility and improved graphics.

consoles.name: Sega Genesis
consoles.fact: 32 years ago today, the **Sega Genesis** made its debut in North America! Released on August 14, 1989, the Genesis brought Sonic the Hedgehog into the gaming world, establishing Sega as a major player.

consoles.name: Super Nintendo Entertainment System
consoles.fact: 30 years ago today, the **Super Nintendo Entertainment System** (SNES) released in North America! Released on August 23, 1991, the SNES continued Nintendo's success with iconic franchises and advanced graphics.

consoles.name: Sega Saturn
consoles.fact: 27 years ago today, the **Sega Saturn** faced a surprise launch in North America! Released on May 11, 1995, the Saturn struggled in the market despite efforts to compete with the Sony PlayStation.

consoles.name: Sony PlayStation
consoles.fact: 27 years ago today, the **Sony PlayStation** revolutionized gaming in North America! Released on September 9, 1995, it introduced the CD format and a diverse range of titles, becoming a best-seller.

consoles.name: Nintendo 64
consoles.fact: 26 years ago today, the **Nintendo 64** made its debut in North America! Released on September 29, 1996, the N64 introduced 3D gaming and iconic titles like Super Mario 64 and The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time.

consoles.name: Sega Dreamcast
consoles.fact: 22 years ago today, the **Sega Dreamcast** was a pioneer in North America! Released on September 9, 1999, it featured online capabilities but faced challenges leading to Sega's exit from the hardware market.

consoles.name: Sony PlayStation 2
consoles.fact: 21 years ago today, the **Sony PlayStation 2** became a legend in North America! Released on October 26, 2000, it is the best-selling console of all time, offering a vast library of games and DVD playback.

consoles.name: Microsoft Xbox
consoles.fact: 20 years ago today, the **Microsoft Xbox** marked its entry into North America! Released on November 15, 2001, it introduced the Halo franchise and Xbox Live.

consoles.name: Nintendo GameCube
consoles.fact: 20 years ago today, the Nintendo **GameCube** brought joy to North America! Released on November 18, 2001, it featured a compact design and introduced popular franchises like Super Smash Bros. Melee.

consoles.name: Sony PlayStation Portable
consoles.fact: 18 years ago today, the **Sony PlayStation Portable** (PSP) transformed portable gaming in North America! Released on March 24, 2005, it brought impressive graphics and multimedia capabilities.

consoles.name: Microsoft Xbox 360
consoles.fact: 17 years ago today, the **Microsoft Xbox 360** shaped the future of online gaming in North America! Released on November 22, 2005, it introduced HD gaming and Xbox Live.

consoles.name: Sony PlayStation 3
consoles.fact: 16 years ago today, the **Sony PlayStation 3** became a multimedia hub in North America! Released on November 17, 2006, it featured powerful hardware and Blu-ray support.

consoles.name: Nintendo Wii
consoles.fact: 16 years ago today, the **Nintendo Wii** transformed gaming in North America! Released on November 19, 2006, it popularized motion controls and expanded the gaming audience with titles like Wii Sports.

consoles.name: Sony PlayStation Vita
consoles.fact: 11 years ago today, the **Sony PlayStation Vita** amazed gamers in North America! Released on February 22, 2012, it was a portable powerhouse with a vibrant OLED screen and a diverse library of games.

consoles.name: Nintendo Wii U
consoles.fact: 10 years ago today, the **Nintendo Wii U** introduced unique gaming experiences in North America! Released on November 18, 2012, it featured the GamePad controller, paving the way for the Nintendo Switch.

consoles.name: Sony PlayStation 4
consoles.fact: 8 years ago today, the **Sony PlayStation 4** became a powerhouse in North America! Released on November 15, 2013, it featured a strong lineup of exclusive games.

consoles.name: Microsoft Xbox One
consoles.fact: 8 years ago today, the **Microsoft Xbox One** focused on multimedia integration in North America! Released on November 22, 2013, it introduced the Kinect sensor for enhanced user interaction.

consoles.name: Nintendo Switch
consoles.fact: 6 years ago today, the **Nintendo Switch** revolutionized gaming in North America! Released on March 3, 2017, it featured a hybrid design, allowing users to switch between handheld and home console modes.

consoles.name: Sony PlayStation 5
consoles.fact: 2 years ago today, the **Sony PlayStation 5** ushered in the ninth console generation in North America! Released on November 12, 2020, it featured powerful hardware and innovative features.

consoles.name: Microsoft Xbox Series X and Series S
consoles.fact: 2 years ago today, the **Microsoft Xbox Series X and Series S** brought cutting-edge technology to the Xbox family in North America! Released on November 10, 2020, it focused on backward compatibility.
